website_summaries.verdict: A high-stability option from Brooks that's often recommended by podiatrists.
pros: The fit of the Beast 16 is comfortable, and the shoe provides a great deal of stability and support
Adding even more stability, the outsole is incredibly grippy
Provides intensive correction for those with gait issues

customer_reviews.title: By far the BEST shoes for severe over-pronators.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second pair (silver/electric) to alternate with my black pair of Beast 16's that I use for both working out and as a daily pair of work shoes (we don't have a dress code at the office outside of "no slippers and no sleeveless shirts"). The Beast 16's are by far the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned, because even if other brands offer arch support for over-pronation, only Brooks offers the proper kind of support for someone with severe/extreme over-pronation like me (to date). Hell, I love these shoes enough to keep an eye out for them on Black Friday so that I can buy the other two designs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Beast 16 runs larger than Beast 14.
customer_reviews.text: Either the shoe is marked wrong size from the factory or the beast 16 runs much larger than the beast 14. I upgraded the beast 14 size 11.5 D US for beast 16 11.5 D US . The beast 14 fit perfect. The beast 16 ran a size or 2 bigger. I tried wearing them for 3 or 4 days and they even hurt my feet where I cant wear them at all. I can still see both labels on old and new shoes marked exactly same size and width. I have been buying the same size beast 14 11.5 D US for a few pairs now and they all fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Marsh

customer_reviews.title: these have brought hope, healing, and health back into my life.
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a highly active person in high intensity athletics. I have foot problems and wear orthotics as well. After not being able to run/walk/sit without pain for 5years (college and after), these have brought hope, healing, and health back into my life. I can now run 5-10k races no problem and have done a half-marathon. While I would consider other products, these are the only ones on the market that meet my needs and buy a new pair yearly. I cannot praise this product enough. As an unemotional male(ask my wife) thinking how things were and my newly regained abilities, I get emotional.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Fit the same as previous models on 10.5 4E
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn Brooks Beast 10.5 4E for years. I read some reviews complaining that the size of the new ones was smaller. Others said they were the same. I ordered the same size he always gets and the fit was the same. Maybe they changed other sizes, but the 10.5 4E is the same as older models. I hope this review helps others trying to guess what size to order.
customer_reviews.author: Cath Curry

customer_reviews.title: Good Support / Shorter Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the BEST available for motion control and flat feet. The good is that they are roomy and comfortable with marked improvement on any foot pain. Arguably some of the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn with plenty of support. The downside is that they don't seem to last over time. After going through a few pairs, it seems like 6 months max is it before a replacement is needed. Would also like to see nicer looking styling, although I do like the grey option. The grey option does have a thinner material than the other colors, but it does look a bit more premium.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I developed a little toe bunion and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I developed a little toe bunion and had to change from Beast 14 size 11, 2E width to Beast 16 size 11, 4E width. These fit perfectly. Vendor delivered within 2 days. Now I'm back to working out without aggravating my bunion. A word of advise. Don't wear shoes that are not wide enough or you may develop a bunion, and they hurt!
customer_reviews.author: meastman

customer_reviews.title: The new model 16 is not as good as the older model 14.
customer_reviews.text: I was completely disappointed in the new 16 model. The model 14 were the best stability running shoe I ever owned. When I put the new Beast 16 on, the fit was not the same and the side swash design rubbed against my toe on both shoes. I had to return them. I looked for a place to buy an old model 14, but no one has them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Testani

customer_reviews.title: Supportive shoe but can be slippery on wet surfaces
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and supportive shoes but overall it is a bit larger than I expected. I got an 114E and typically I purchase the extended width size. With thick socks, this isn't an issue. What is an issue is what some other reviewers have noted: The base is slippery on wet surfaces! I almost took a tumble when I took the dog for a walk after a rainstorm. The concrete driveway was slick, made worse by downed leaves or pine straw. I had to walk very carefully so as not to slide at each step. I can't imagine running in these on wet surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: PeteEd

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this model
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 6 pairs of the previous beast models and this one is terrible. The size is way different than in previous models. My toes were busting out of my normal size so I purchased another pair in the next size up and they were way to bigger than most size 13s.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes for bigger guys.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big guy and buying shoes to go running is really hard. I’ve had brooks adrenaline and they were good but didn’t have that arch support I needed. But Brooks beast is really helped that issue. Not only do they have really good arch support but are nice and wide for my feet. They are a little bit heavier than most shoes but the comfort outweighs the the weight of the shoe by a long short.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Dickerson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Still the best athletic shoe for heavy people with bad feet.
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavy man with wide flat feet, arthritis in my feet and ankles, and bone spurs that made my podiatrist say "wow" in a very sincere and concerned way when he saw the xrays for the first time. And Brooks Beast are the only shoes I can comfortably wear for exercise. They last around 6 months before they should be replaced, whereas similar shoes from other brands last only half that long. These '16 edition of the Beast come in a nice color and they continue to provide unparalleled support.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mcnelis

customer_reviews.title: Knock offs or fakes
customer_reviews.text: Love these for being on my feet 12+ hours running through a hospital from one end to another. So I purchased these black ones in sept of 2018 form this supplier and they have fell apart already. I purchased the silver ones 2 years ago from the running store and they are still holding up well, I used them pretty much everyday until I purchased the new black ones. 2 years vs 5 months ... I don’t know if they cheapen them to sell on amazon or if they are just outright knock offs or fakes mascarading as Brooks. Extremely disappointing so I had to fix my review. For over 100 bucks I will take my briskness to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Jay C

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: Brooks is the best fitting running/walking shoe for me and has been for decades. I have a wide forefoot, high instep and narrow heel. If that describes your feet you should give Brooks a try. The build quality is on par with other major brands such as Adidas, Nike and New Balance. After getting old and putting on too much weight I decided to try these "Beasts" - I'll try to remember and update this review after I've put a few miles on them. Out of the box they fit and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: F. L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought a half size larger, a legit 4E
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought a half size larger than my nominal size. The forefoot is a legit 4E width, but with the taper I'm glad for a bit of room in front of my toes. I'm not particularly a fan of the shiny surfaces, so I'm dinging it a star for looks. The tubular laces have a lot of elasticity. I'm not sure if that's good or not yet. The laces are long enough to work with my high instep, so that's a plus. I'd say the arch support is moderate...better than most without a third party footbed insert.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Used shoes?!
customer_reviews.text: Wth?!? They sent me USED shoes!!! I noticed they were laced up, which meant they had been tried on. I rearranged the lacing to the way I like it then went to stick my foot in the shoe and there was a pair of black no show socks rolled up and shoved into the toe of the left shoe. I paid $170 for this?!? The bottoms didn't show any signs of being worn, but the sheer grossness of blindly pulling a pair of used socks out of them... ugggh! Unfortunately, my old pair are in the washing machine wet and I had to suck it up and wear the "new" ones to work today.
customer_reviews.author: Don Gantt

customer_reviews.title: Big guys 300lbs plus think about getting these
customer_reviews.text: A little more firm in the mid-sole and heel than earlier models. Been purchasing these since '07-'08. Very durable for big guys with lots of support. When I started my journey, thse were exactly what I needed. I wished that they were still like $100 like back in the day. Oh well... I will continue buying these shoes for as long as the keep making them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Brooks needs better quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband to replace same brand, size, style, but these were uncomfortable, had a seem or something inside that gave him blisters first time he wore them. Returned them. Purchased another pair at a local store where he could try them on, And those were fine. Brooks needs better quality control. These are the best running shoes for his feet, just can't trust the QC to purchase online anymore. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes Except for Holes in the Toes
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth pair of Brooks I have owned and it may be the last for one simple reason- the mesh at the big toe wears through. These are great shoes in every other way but for the cost of these shoes the toe area should be stronger. I have even started to put duct tape on the inside at the toe area to get more use out of them. I walk 4-5 miles per day on concrete at my job and can only get a max of 5-6 months out of these shoes before they need to be replaced. There is no other signs of wear on them save for the holes in the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Beast 16's are a great shoe for me.
customer_reviews.text: The Beast's 16 are great shoes. When you have multiple foot issues like I do, finding any type of shoe that is comfortable for a day of walking concrete floors as a teacher is a definite bonus. I have three pairs of Brooks Addiction that I found to be ultra comfortable and after reading a review, decided to give the Beast 16's a try. Brooks said they tended to run about a half size small, so I followed their suggestion and up mine from 10 to 10 1/2 . Their may be a bit more space in the toe box, the shoes feel great on my feet. Can you ask for more?
customer_reviews.author: J. Boling

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: a long time ago I went to a local " foot " store that had me run on a treadmill and they recommended Brooks Beast because of over pronation. Loved them at the time. I quit running for about 2 years. Started again decided to try the Beast again. OMG the worst shoe!!! Hurt my feet, my calves, slowed me down. NO FLEXABILITY. Did some research into overpronation, found that was NOT my running style. Not sure why the Beast had worked so well 10 years ago but they are NO LONGER my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Starr

customer_reviews.title: Bring back the Beast 14!
customer_reviews.text: Bring back the Beast 14! The Beast 14 was my go to running shoe to support my suppination, and durability. The company went cheap on these. Comfort yes, but no where near the sole durability or support as the 14. Heal cushion unevenness started to show after only a couple of times wearing. So disappointed for a shoe that worked before, is now, not only more expensive, but cheaper in quality, performance, and durability.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog Father

customer_reviews.title: Bottom of shoes fall apart!
customer_reviews.text: The outermost thin layer of sole peels off with very little time from normal walking. This happened on both shoes! The flapping result of the bottom of the shoe causes my foot to get caught on things and trip! The materials are good looking and comfortable but the assembly glue is crap! Tried to crazy glue it back together but that didn’t hold long either.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Beastly! But overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed 2 pair of these during a lightning sale for $120.00. a pair. I have owned a few pairs of these sneakers over the last 5 years. I have to say these sneakers hold up better than Asics, and new balance. My only issue is the keep going up in price, also I wish the laces were longer. These are excellent for overpronation. Hopefully I can continue to grab these during lightning deals. Update 3/22/19. Looks like I'll be purchasing a different sneaker going forward. The price now is WAY outta control for these!
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sizing problem
customer_reviews.text: I had been buyting 10.5 Beasts for several years which fit fine. When the numered series came Ihave have tried seeral of the versions , 14, 15 and 16. All of these seem to run a bit shorter than before. This time I oered a 11 and is is a bit too long, which the other were too shore. I get a little heel rub with these, but is mostly fixed with lacing. Still great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Frelinger

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have a narrower toe box
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and the Peacoat Navy color that I got, but the fit runs a bit smaller. This shoe seems to have a narrower toe box that I don't like. I ordered a half size bigger because I like more toe space. Still seems a bit tight. I use D medium. Hopefully they'll feel better as they stretch out. Just got them so I can't really comment on how they feel during or after running.
customer_reviews.author: Albert C.

customer_reviews.title: I love them because they secure my ankles better than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits a bit small, also on the heavier side as far as shoes go. I love them because they secure my ankles better than the adrenaline's and give me the best (flat feet) support. Hopefully the bottoms last longer than my last pair. The rubber tends to slice and peel off creating an imbalance. Last pair held together a year of gym abuse
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t found any better walking/running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Brooks Beast for more than 15 years. I own most colors. I need strong pronation control due to old injury. But these shoes are expensive. I try to purchase models on sale. Some of the more recent versions don’t seem to hold up quite as well as some others I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Surfnhbusa

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable, travel well.
customer_reviews.text: Husband has been wearing the BEAST brand for about 20 years now, and LOVES them --- poor guy has terribly flat feet and pronates horribly, so these shoes are comfortable, supportive and durable - They will actually last about two years for him, and then when he finally gets new ones, we recycle the previous pair to yard work and other messy chores. Definitely recommend them - great value!
customer_reviews.author: Nana-the-Baker

customer_reviews.title: Get these now...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the saucony omni 14 since the beast price went through the roof a few years ago. I found these for under a hundred bucks. I have missed them. They just feel better than the omni, but the omni are no slouch. I use the beast 16 for working out and the omni for around town. I will not buy any other shoes but these two brands.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe of its kind
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of Brooks Beast. In my opinion the "Beast" is the best shoe of its kind, and this new pair is no exception to that opinion. When it came time to buy a new pair I read online reviews, which suggested buying a half-size larger than normal. I did, and they fit perfectly. They are comfortable to wear, provide a stable platform for my feet, and are great for walking, jogging or working out at the gym. They look great too, particularly the Anthracite/Black/Silver combo that I bought.
customer_reviews.author: JIM DONOVAN

customer_reviews.title: Fit a bit small.
customer_reviews.text: I have kind of an odd foot. Some brands I can wear 12, some I have to wear 13’s. I ordered these in 12.5, one of the first times I’ve seen a 12.5. However, they wear still too small. I don’t even think I could have worn a 13 in them and I’ve never had to buy 14’s in any shoe. I really liked the look, however, I had to return them for a refund as they don’t sell this style/color in a larger size. I didn’t exchange them because I wasn’t all that found of the other colors.
customer_reviews.author: My87z

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for my son. They help amazingly with his posterior tibial tendon disfunction. His feet are extremely flat. His right one is so bad it's collapsed and rolls to the inside when he walks. He has a brace. But, often needs breaks from it. These give him exactly the amount of support get needs. They are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Laster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, sturdy shoes.
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist recommended these shoes because of their very stiff sole good arch support. I also use the additional arch inserts that he recommended under the stock sole liner. Excellent shoes, very comfortable, very sturdy. I use them for walking and for strength training; I gave up running some time ago, so cannot comment on their use in running.
customer_reviews.author: L. Macklem

customer_reviews.title: Lost some of their luster
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost. These are great shoes for overweight people with fallen arches. I have purchased many pair through the years. My only complaint is they used to have more cool features. Like silver thread for anti fungal protection. They used to last a lot longer. Look....i am not going to stop buying them. I just miss the extras.
customer_reviews.author: sai2sword9

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to wear these shoes yet, but they seem to be the same fit and comfort of my 2 or 3 previous Beast shoes. The color is very nice and will look good with jeans. Shoes came much sooner than had been projected by shipper. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: R. George

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my husband for work and play. Hes on his feet a lot and has had multiple foot surgeries and these were recommended by a physical therapist....now our daughter, who's a nurse, just bought a pair and loves them as well! Quality. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ExecSec

customer_reviews.title: The Brooks Beast Is King of the walking shoe jungle 👍😃
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks Beast for 6 years. I bought my first pair 6 months after I badly broke my left ankle in 2012 causing long term peripheral nerves damage. This is the only shoe which gives great support in every areas of the foot and ankle. Five ankle surgeries later, I am still wearing the Beast. I am now walking 3-5 miles per day, largely because of this outstanding product. Just received the latest model. It has exceeded all my performance expectations. Thie Brooks Beast is the “Real Deal” Wayne Rutherford
customer_reviews.author: wayne rutherford

customer_reviews.title: One of the best support for your feet in any running shoes out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd generation of this model that I use. My feet need the strongest support when I walk or run and the Brooks Beast definitely delivers! Every time I do exercise or go to take a walk in these shoes I feel extremely comfortable while the shoes are staying in place firmly. They last long and this 2016 model is even lighter than the previous ones (12 & 14) that I have used. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Nice cushion and Support
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these sneakers. I have 4E feet and need a generous toe box. I additionally like a nice breathable shoe for the warm and humid weather. As a 6ft 1in 300lb guy. These give me nice cushiness while still feeling support. This show delivers all around and I would buy it again. If you don’t need to say you have the most current year you can save some bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Thin mesh material
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks Beast shoes, but these new 16 BB are all mesh over the toe box...and this is where they fail. Could see through them. Had to return. Not a good shoe for work.
customer_reviews.author: Drykard

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: Brooks beast has always been my go to for motion control running shoes. I’ll be honest in that I have strayed from them when I see a sale on mizunos or saucony but my feet, ankles, and shins always end up hurting and I come crawling back to the Beast... love this shoe
customer_reviews.author: Hshdhd

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but go 1/2 size up!
customer_reviews.text: Good update to the Beast "franchise". Great look and great support is there, as everyone has come to expect from the Beast. I've been wearing the Beast since the original in 1997. I've worn size 11.5D for every iteration of this shoe. However, the 11.5EE was too small. There was no room in the toe box. I'll return the 11.5EE and get a 12EE.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: more comfortable than previous versions. fit as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing beasts for 10 years, and this version is the most comfortable to me. The cushioning and the upper seem more plush. The tongue is more comfortable than the 14's since it's not gusseted into the upper. I usually wear 8.5 4E in previous versions, and I found the fit to be the same for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Shopper619

customer_reviews.title: Always love brooks Ariel  shoes !
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy 10 wide Ariel show, however the 2018 version does not fit the same at all. Both the brooks beast and the Ariel run small. I normally wear a 9.5 and have to order a 10 in the women’s and a 9 in the beast . Great arch support for severe over pronation and fallen arches
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ross

customer_reviews.title: I have worn the Brooks Beast for 10 years. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the Brooks Beast for 10 years. These were cut smaller in the forefoot. Having years of experience with this shoe, I assumed a small abnormally with this pair that would adjust out, it never did.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Brizendine

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of the Beast. Purchased the earlier model several years ago and it has run it's course. This pair is great. Arch support not that great so i am using Super Feet supports. Love the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: RMA

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I added a full size over my regular street shoes when I first ordered these shoes. I really liked the shoes, but they were just too short. I added an additional half size and they were perfect. It’s a very supportive shoe, but really comfortable. Looks really good also.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Improved Aesthetics
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Brooks beast for years due to the wide sizes and functionality. Until the 2016 year, they were only offered in bright, flamboyant colors. This black color scheme runs under the radar at work and still fits great. Keep up the stealth option.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Commuter

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay but they are holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Went up a size. They are a bit heavy but I got them because the price was right and I wanted something for the gym. I've run in them a few times and they are awkward at first (big) but after a while you will get accustomed to them. I rotate them with several other running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Navas

customer_reviews.title: I have feet like a duck
customer_reviews.text: I have feet like a duck: 9.5 4E. As a result, I've gone through more pairs of shoes than Imelda Marcos. These shoes are truly extraordinary and I speak as a former shoemaker. Superb fit and comfort, beautiful construction, and worth every penny of their price although more and more sellers are discounting them which is why I now own 4 (yes, I said four) pairs. If only they were made in the US...oh, well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Gary B. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: 5 W and I went with an 11 thinking that would be a perfect fit. This may be the case why my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes in August of 2017. I've done mostly walking and a bit of hiking. I think I've order them somewhat large on my foot. I am a 10.5 W and I went with an 11 thinking that would be a perfect fit. This may be the case why my feet is sliding further to the right/left creating supination causing me to have shin splint pains. Also the material. The gray area of material is not as tough or durable as I thought it would be. Thinking about and looking it over I wouldn't of gone to spend the amount of money I paid for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Marden De Castro

customer_reviews.title: Love the feel but next time I am going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy one size too big. I usually wear a 12, I bought 13. Always, I bought a 4E insteatd of a 2E. Fits well but you have to know that their sizes are tiny going in. Love the feel but next time I am going to the local running store for a custom fitted shoe. I'm tired of guessing.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: ARMY BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes on the market for durability mainly because they’re quite heavy. But if you want a long lasting shoe and enjoy running daily like I do without injury then this is only shoe for you.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Korol

customer_reviews.title: Mid-sole arch not for flat-footed running, but makes walking a pleasure.  Go with the Adrenaline GTS!
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm a Brooks fan, but the Brooks Beast 16 is supposed to be for heavier Flat-footed runners. But I found the mid-sole arch uncomfortably pressing my foot upwards and running in them became unbearable. But, I kept them because they do make and excellent walking shoe oddly enough. The cushioning outshines any shoe I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: vedderx79

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: My foot doctor recommended these and I have not been disappointed. I do a lot of urban walking and these shoes provide great support and have limited the amount of ankle and foot pain I was experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Veblen

customer_reviews.title: The Best of the Best for Heavy Runners
customer_reviews.text: If you're a big guy, have about 50 pounds more on you (muscle of course) than the average runner, you can't go wrong with Brooks Beast. This is about the only shoe I've been able to find that works well for me. The only downside is my big toes poke a hole through the top of the shoe fairly quickly...
customer_reviews.author: Tall Timbers

customer_reviews.title: Re reviewing... 👎
customer_reviews.text: Re reviewing...After 2 months of light wear they are starting to fall apart. For the price I paid, that should NOT happen. My original review was 5 stars. When you pay that much money for a “good” pair of shoes you expect them to last. I regret purchasing these 2 months later and I won’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunky

customer_reviews.title: Order one half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: If you read the reviews that many wrote stating to order a half size larger as the new Beast was running smaller than the last iteration. I did and they fit perfect. To sum it up ORDER ONE HALF SIZE LARGER. Great shoe and more stylish than the last version. No neon or pink, just a good performing adult styled shoe.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Beast Rules
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about the Brooks Beast. The fit is perfect but more importantly the support and "motion control" has saved my back. If you need stability and/or motion control, these are the best. I've had six pairs or more.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R.

customer_reviews.title: Hate to give up on them but....
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Brooks in the past and have always been a 13D. I had my feet re measured to make sure the size had not changed and it hasn't. Now the Brooks size 13D is so small I can barely get my foot into it and the 14 is too large. Unfortunately after many years of being quite satisfied with Brooks I will have to go to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Brooks: Comfort and support as usual
customer_reviews.text: Fit great. Offer excellent support. Not the same quality of previous models. The insoles immediately started to unglue from inside and create an irritating edge to feel under my foot. This is my third pair of this exact shoe. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jshopper

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: Brooks, although made in China, are probably the best shoes for people like myself that are a little more chunky than we should be. Good support and comfortable if you're on your feet a lot. I also heard that they are great for runners!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Foot pain gone
customer_reviews.text: I have serious foot pain. There were many days when I got home from work I had to sit with my feet up because the pain was to extreme to walk. Brooks were recomendé to me by a specialty shoe store and boy did they work. As long as I wear the Brooks the pain is gone. Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.author: D and P M

customer_reviews.title: And this latest generation it looks like Brooks has made several improvements
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing Brooks Beast since 2006. I cant find another shoe that allows me to run the way I have to and not cause a lot of foot pain. And this latest generation it looks like Brooks has made several improvements. The back of the shoe is more ridged, with the sole being more flexible and the shoe feels like it has lost weight!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems to run a bit small / neuroma
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem to run a bit small for me at least, normal 10.5 and exchanged for 11. The shoes are nicely cushioned throughout but if you have a forefoot neuroma these might not be the best solution due to the heel to toe decline or slope - even with my custom orthotics I couldn't get comfortable. Good shoes, just not for my situation - returned.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Either a fluke or not very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for the gym. Didn't wear them for the first couple of months because I was in a walking boot for an injury. Basically have been wearing them for a month and the inside is falling apart. See the attached picture. I paid $160 for these. I expected better. Knowing this is the Beast line, I hope this is just a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: I'm with the band

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the Beast '14
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like the Beast '14. New method over the old way of construction is considerably less comfortable and this pair actually hurt my feet. My problem is where it goes around the 5th metatarsal head (the part that sticks out just before your pinky toe). It was so tight there that it nearly brought me to tears when it pulled in there. The '14s never did this, sadly I can't find any new 12 4-E '14s out there. I am going to have to find another stability control shoe because this was just not acceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Fleeman

customer_reviews.title: These are really good shoes, next time I need to up the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really good shoes, next time I need to up the size by 1/2. I wear a 10 or 10.5 in regular shoes (I mostly wear keens due to very flat feet). These work well for walking/jogging but I ordered an 11 and will do a 11.5 next time. They run very small.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: these shoes wear very poorly
customer_reviews.text: The fabric on the front on the shoe by the big toe started wearing through within the second month. I only wear these shoes a couple of hours in the evening and on weekends. For the price they charge, this shoe should last more than a few months. When searching for product reviews online, the rapid wearing down of the fabric on top was mentioned in a few reviews. This is exactly what happened to my shoes. Do not waste your money on Brooks shoes
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: THIS HAS BECOME MY "GO TO' SHOE, ESPECIALLY WHEN ...
customer_reviews.text: THIS HAS BECOME MY "GO TO' SHOE, ESPECIALLY WHEN IT IS ON SALE...WHEN IT IS PRICED AT ITS USUAL COST [ 160.00 ], I HAVE SOME TROUBLE WITH THAT... HOWEVER, IT WEARS WELL AND GIVES ME THE STABLE PLATFORM I DESIRE WHEN I AM ON MY FEET ALL DAY.
customer_reviews.author: productuser

customer_reviews.title: These are by far the best shoes I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best shoes I have ever bought. If you walked pronated (walk on the instep of your foot) theses are the best shoes for you. They help correct it and are VERY COMFORTABLE!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Manley

customer_reviews.title: Very squeaky and loud.
customer_reviews.text: I have very flat feet and have always worn New Balance 1540 which work well. These look better so I gave them a try. They have good support and stability but they squeak loudly with every step. The more I wore them the worse they got. I wanted to wear them but couldn't take the squeaking.
customer_reviews.author: DGL

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe For The Big Guys
customer_reviews.text: At first, my son complained that they weren't "just like his old Beasts" and didn't "fit right". Then I explained that they changed the color and the old color wasn't available anymore and didn't he like black better anyway? Instantly the fit was perfect, just like before. He's 6'7", 230lbs, and wears a size 15.
customer_reviews.author: Practigal

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: Supplier was great, no issues. Shoes are exact model, size and color as ones previously purchased, but they are narrower in the midfoot. Like the shoe is really a 2E and was marked as a 4E. Caused blistering near ball of my foot on the first run. This never happened with the last pair
customer_reviews.author: Connor B

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.  High price.
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis. This shoe with a custom orthotics insert keeps me pain free. Don't bother shopping for a better price. Brooks manages to force all sellers to sell at their full retail price. Isn't there a law against that?
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Just Right (like Goldilocks)!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit "right out of the box". As a matter of fact, they went into use immediately. Great, comfortable fit with good color scheme. Actually, received a number of compliments on the look within the first week of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Finally, A Mostly Black Brooks
customer_reviews.text: The design of this shoe is better than the other colors. The mesh overlay provides a roomier toe box. Besides the price, the only downside is the larger silver reflective logo since I wear these at the office due to foot and knee issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my flat foot pain (recommended by my foot doctor)
customer_reviews.text: Bought it at the recommendation of my foot doctor and no longer had flat foot pain even after walking for miles and miles. (I think so because my injection of cortisone should have been worn off after 2 years. But of course I am also wearing clog at home). I have worn this pair of shoes to hike and to walk every day for exercising for 2 years now and they have not really shown any significant sign of wear or tear yet. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I use these for exercise walking and slow jogging and I loved the first two pairs
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Brooks Beast shoes. I previously bought the Beast '14 and Beast '12. I use these for exercise walking and slow jogging and I loved the first two pairs. These shoes, however, caused pain in the inside of my heel after half a block. The tilt to the outside is way more pronounced than in the previous shoes. For me, they've gone too far in preventing overpronation. It's really unfortunate. Now I'm back to the drawing board to find properly supportive walking/running shoes. I posted a picture from the back so you can see just how tilted it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Karnick

customer_reviews.title: Thread unraveling....1 month old
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Brooks and may be my last. Im very disappointed in the quality of this pair as the toe portion is already coming unraveled on both shoes. Paying $120 for shoes should mean they last longer than 1 month. I don’t even run just simply wear as normal use to protect my fallen arches. And of course now I’m out of my return window. So disappointed in this purchase. I gave it 2 stars because they are very comfortable but bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have looked for years for a good fitting shoe so that my right foot dont hurt,, this is was it so far. I it was cheaper than most of the others ones a have tried. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A big hit in looks and comfort- size up
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews we sized up. Husband normally wears an 11 but a 12 fit perfectly. My husband has a lot of foot problems, flat feet , bunions and more. The gray tone is attractive and my husband says they are the most comfortable sneakers he has ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable shoes, but I don't think they are not worth the price. It might be my foot, but these shoes seem to force me to walk on the sides of my feet. It's kind of hard to describe. I will probably stick to my Nike running shoes next time.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Item exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my husband. Brooks shoes are one of the top brands and are definitely better than Nike or Reebok.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa79

customer_reviews.title: ... to choose a half size larger to get a good fit. This is the best shoe made
customer_reviews.text: It helps to choose a half size larger to get a good fit. This is the best shoe made. I have 41 pair of running shoes and this one is my favorite. I have 12 pair of Brooks, and this one is the top of the line for me. Although the Ghost and Glycerin are great too
customer_reviews.author: ralph harris

customer_reviews.title: I wish I didn’t need a shoe like this but I am glad it is out there
customer_reviews.text: I wish I didn’t need a shoe like this but I am glad it is out there...I am overweight with ortho problems from being a young reckless knuckle head, I have had multiple surgeries including a PTT replacement, these shoes get me through the day
customer_reviews.author: BostonMike

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time here if you're a Beast fan
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Beast 16 did not go well. Many of the fit and quality issues discussed in the forum are on the money. Half sizes are even more wonky than whole sizes. Returned this model and ordered the Beast 18s. Don't waste your time here if you're a Beast fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is fantastic. I started wearing Brooks Beasts exclusively about five ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is fantastic. I started wearing Brooks Beasts exclusively about five years ago. I run between 17 and 34 miles a week depending on my training schedule. I have yet to experience shin splints in these shoes so long as I order new shoes about every quarter (200mi-400mi).
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kmetz

customer_reviews.title: Makes running painless for over pronators
customer_reviews.text: My husband over pronates and these shoes make a huge difference when he runs. They look a little funny, but he won't run in anything else. The shoe box came in pretty beat up, but the shoes were not used.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Same Size As Beast '14's - Excellent Prodiuct
customer_reviews.text: I have foot arthritis and other orthopedic issues, so I wear these sneakers for support in walking and other exercise, but not running. I have been wearing Beast 14's, which I love. The 16's are even more comfortable, supportive, and stylish. My 14's are 11.5 EE, so I ordered the same in the 16's. Perfect fit! I should note that Brooks sneakers run small (no pun intended), and it took several tries to determine by Brooks size. My other shoes are mostly 11 M. I highly recommend the Brooks 16's. I will buy more in other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Briarcliff Customer

customer_reviews.title: New or Worn?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair of Brooks Men's Beast 16. When they arrived it was apparent to me that someone either tried them on or actually worn them. There were no tags that normally come with a new pair of sneakers, also absent was the paper commonly found inside a new pair and the shoelaces were already tied.
customer_reviews.author: William Ryan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT support for overpronation!
customer_reviews.text: I had to use a mens shoe to get the gray without the bright women's colors for work. I reduced the shoe length and width for me and it's still a little wide for me, but I can't match the incredible support of these shoes for my overpronation. They are wonderfully supportive!!!
customer_reviews.author: BHGMom

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Beast - The Running Shoes for the heavy men.
customer_reviews.text: Running is my exercise. Brooks Beast is my shoe for over 15 years. I chose a support cushioned shoes after a suffered injury running in shoes that did not support my heavy 206 weight. Brooks Beast offer support, good toe box, excellent cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: JAHMAKER

customer_reviews.title: Nevet again
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this version of the beast. Not worth the price. It's been a while since I've owned Beast so I thought I would give them a tray again. I should have stayed with my new balance 994s. I'll never buy the beast again. When I walk and run it doesn't feel right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have an ankle product and went in to get better shoes. They put me in these but couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an ankle product and went in to get better shoes. They put me in these but couldn't get the black ones through the company. I have wide feet so it is nice to find shoes that go up to my size (14 4E). I have been playing racket ball in the and they fit nice and seem to help my ankle alot.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lukenbach

customer_reviews.title: These are easily the least comfortable running shoes that I have ever ...
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the least comfortable running shoes that I have ever used. They are also very heavy. I literally feel as though i am running with clogs on. I really believe that I would be just as comfortable running in work boots.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Laborda

customer_reviews.title: Top 3 shoe for flat feet n I've tried many
customer_reviews.text: Worst flat feet of anyone I know. And if you have them too you know all the aches that come with them. Particularly top of the outside ankle. These have definitely helped relieve some of those pains. .
customer_reviews.author: Wukong

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and high quality shoe with enough support even for tired old feet stricken with Plantars Faciatus and bad ankles. I can walk the dog again with these shoes. Just wore my first pair out and bought two more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: SDH

customer_reviews.title: These beasts are beauties.
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing beasts for a long time. Needed a flat bottom shoe for the custom fitted arch supports for my plantar fasciatis. They work well, come in extra extra wide size I need, are durable, available in colors, and *reasonably* priced for a quality shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mart

customer_reviews.title: The Best Pronation and Cushion Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using these shoes for the gym to workout and occasional going out. They are great! I also suffer from planters fasciitis and they help in taking the pounding from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gomez

product_meta.title: Brooks Mens Beast '16
product_meta.description: Go HAM on those last few miles as you muscle through your run in the Brooks® Beast '16! Predecessor: Beast 14. Support Type: Overpronation/Stability. Cushioning: Maximum cushioning. Surface: Road. Differential: 12 mm. Built for the sever overpronator who requires motion control and high-level cushioning. Moisture-managing Element mesh upper supplies protection from various elements, while maintaining a cool in-shoe environment. External, structured saddle allows for adjustable support. Lace-up closure. External heel counter helps stabilize the foot. Plush tongue and collar. Element mesh lining wicks moisture away, and offers a great in-shoe feel. Removable sockliner. Super DNA midsole delivers maximum cushioning, enhanced energy return, and support. Full-length S-257 Cushsole midsole compound utilizes an insole board for increased plush and flexibility. Tuned density to fit this runner's specific needs. DRB® Accel shank-like unit promotes torsional rigidity in the mid-foot, while allowing the heel and forefoot to act independently. Extended Progressive Diagonal Rollbar (PDRB) presents a robust, dual density post at the medial arch allowing for progressive pronation control. Full-length Segmented Crash Pad encourages a smooth heel-to-toe transition with each step. Durable HPR Green™ outsole is comprised of environment-friendly silica for premium wet-dry traction and skid resistance. Abrasion-resistant HPR Plus rubber outsole provides extended durability right where it's needed. Omega Flex Grooves allow for more natural forefoot movement and fluidity. Linear platform. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 13.6 oz Product measurements were taken using size 9, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size.
feature_bullets: Fashion Trend: Ankle-High Synthetic Running Shoe
